document_info.file_name: Example Viking QAP013.01 Risk Management Final.pdf
document_info.file_path: /Users/matthewparson/Desktop/SC/Risk Management/Example Viking QAP013.01 Risk Management Final.pdf

requirements_results.rationale: The submitted QAP013.01 Risk Management Program SOP establishes, implements, documents and requires maintenance of an ongoing risk management process that covers the product lifecycle and includes risk analysis, risk evaluation, risk control, and production & post-production activities. Evidence of a process flowchart (Figure 1) and cross-references to QMS documents (QAP012 Design Control, QAP001 Document Control, QAP011 Training Program, Post Market Surveillance / Complaint Handling) are present. However, some cross‑references use placeholders (e.g., "XX-XXX", "XX-YYY") and the SOP explicitly states it does not define specific thresholds for acceptable risk (section 1.3), deferring those to top management / the Risk Management Plan. Because of these incomplete references and the lack of clearly documented numeric/definitive risk acceptability criteria within the SOP itself, the acceptance criteria are only partially satisfied and require closure actions.
evidence: Page 3, Section 1.1: "The purpose of this Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) is to establish, implement, document and maintain an ongoing process for risk management..."

Page 3, Section 1.2 (Scope): "This SOP applies ... throughout the product lifecycle phases, including product development, technology and design transfer, manufacturing, product surveillance and product discontinuation."

Page 7, Section 5.1.4: "The risk management process includes the following elements throughout the product life cycle: 5.1.4.1. Identifying hazards... 5.1.4.2. Estimating and evaluating the associated risks 5.1.4.3. Controlling risk and monitoring the effectiveness of the risk control measures ... 5.1.4.6. Periodic review of identified risks"

Page 8, Section 5.2.3: "For the particular combination product ... a risk management plan shall be documented and shall include the following, at a minimum: 5.2.3.1. The scope ... and the lifecycle phases ... 5.2.3.2. Assignment of responsibilities and authorities ..."

Page 10, Section 5.3.1-5.3.6: "For the combination product being considered, a risk management file shall be established and maintained throughout the product lifecycle... The risk management file shall be maintained in the associated combination product design history file (DHF)."

Page 7, Section 5.1.5 and Figure 1 (Risk Management Overview): Process map showing Risk analysis -> Risk evaluation -> Risk control -> Evaluation of overall residual risk -> Risk management review -> Production and post-production activities (Figure visible in attachment image).
Page 7, Section 5.1.2: "Risk management is integrated within QAP012, Design Control as part of product realization."
Page 8, Section 5.2.7 and Page 11, Section 5.5.1: Verification/validation linked to QAP012 and design verification procedures.
Page 7, Section 5.1.8: "Appropriate competence and training program requirements are described in QAP011, GMP Training Program."

Page 10, Section 5.3.5: "The contents of the risk management file ... shall be controlled and maintained in the document management system in accordance with QAP001, Format, Content, Approval and Issuance of Controlled Documents."

Page 3, Section 1.3: "This SOP does not define the threshold for acceptable risk (or risk index) since this threshold will change based on the intended use and expected benefit of using the combination product."
Page 9, Section 5.2.3.2.2: "Top management ... establish acceptable thresholds for residual risk acceptance within this procedure." (shows responsibility but not numeric thresholds)

Multiple locations: Some cross-references use placeholders: e.g. Section 1.4 references "XX-XXX, Supplier Qualification and Management" and Sections mentioning "XX-YYY, Management Responsibility" (placeholders present).
gaps: Several cross-references use placeholder identifiers (e.g., "XX-XXX", "XX-YYY") instead of finished document IDs, reducing clarity of QMS linkages.

The SOP explicitly states it does not define thresholds for acceptable risk (Section 1.3) and does not include numeric or specific risk acceptability criteria within the SOP itself; it defers these to top management/Risk Management Plan but does not show a finalized, controlled location for those criteria in the excerpt.

Although the process map (Figure 1) is present, the SOP does not include in-text details showing where the process flow is controlled/versioned in the document management system (figure is present but ensure figure is controlled and legible in the controlled document).
No explicit citation in the excerpt of where the finalized Risk Management Plan template or the Quality Manual states the integrated QMS mapping (though several QAP references are present).
The SOP refers to post‑market surveillance and complaint handling but does not show the specific QMS procedure/document number for those processes in the excerpt.
recommendations: Replace all placeholder cross-references (e.g., "XX-XXX", "XX-YYY") with the final, controlled document identifiers so cross‑references to Supplier Qualification, Management Responsibility, and other QMS processes are unambiguous.

Document and include (or reference a controlled location for) the organization’s defined risk acceptance criteria or an explicit pointer to the Risk Management Plan that contains the acceptance criteria. If thresholds must be product-specific, include the process for establishing and approving those thresholds (who, when, where) in the SOP or in the Risk Management Plan, and ensure those records are indexed in the Risk Management File.

Confirm and document that Figure 1 (Risk Management Overview) is part of the controlled SOP (with revision/version) and is legible in the controlled record; if not, insert a controlled/high-resolution figure in the SOP file and reference its version.

Ensure the SOP explicitly references the Post Market Surveillance and Complaint Handling procedure/document identifier (or add it to the references list) to close the traceability to production & post-production processes.

Include a short clause or a cross-reference to the Quality Manual or other QMS document that maps how risk management activities integrate with Design Control, Document Control, Training, Supplier Management, and Management Review (or ensure the Quality Manual contains that mapping and cite it by document number).
Maintain evidence of approval by top management of the SOP and the defined risk acceptability approach, and store that approval record in the Risk Management File.

requirements_results.rationale: The SOP (QAP013.01) documents top management responsibilities and commitment to provide resources and assign competent personnel, and references a training program (QAP011) and management review process (XX-YYY). It therefore demonstrates management intent and defined roles (partial satisfaction of Clause 4.2). However, the excerpt does not contain the required documentary evidence of management commitment (e.g., management review minutes capturing resourcing decisions, org chart showing assigned roles, resource plans, or completed training records). Because the requirement asks for evidence (management review records; org charts; resource plans; training plans/records) and those artifacts are not present in the provided material, the criterion is only partially satisfied and is FLAGGED pending provision of the expected artifacts.
evidence: Section 2.1 Responsibilities: "Viking Therapeutics Product Development and Quality Assurance (QA) are responsible for ensuring compliance with this SOP." (see Responsibilities, top of excerpt).

Functional Area Management (Responsibilities table): "Assures adequate resources and support to carry out this process." and "Ensures provision of adequate resources and assignment of competent personnel for risk management." (Roles/Responsibilities section).

Quality Assurance responsibilities: "Completes all required training and qualification activities prior to conducting formal risk analysis" and "Defines and documents criteria for risk acceptability in the Risk Management Plan..." (Responsibilities / Quality Assurance).

Section 5.1.6: "management shall regularly review the outputs of processes, products, services, and the quality system, and make improvements as needed, in accordance with the Management Review Process specified in XX-YYY, Management Responsibility."

Section 5.11.1.6: "Top management of Product Development, Clinical Development, Regulatory Affairs, and QA must approve the risk management report if the benefit risk assessment is needed to justify release of the product according to established risk thresholds."
Section 5.1.8: "Appropriate competence and training program requirements are described in QAP011, GMP Training Program."
gaps: No management review minutes or records are included that demonstrate top-management decisions on resourcing for risk management (e.g., documented resource allocations, actions arising from management review).
No organizational chart (org chart) or formal document showing explicit assignment of named competent personnel or their roles/authorities for risk management is provided in the excerpt.
No resource plan, budget, or resourcing decision record (e.g., staffing plan or approved resource allocation) is present to demonstrate that adequate resources were assigned.
No training plan document or evidence of completed training records for personnel assigned to conduct risk management (e.g., records from QAP011 showing training completion) is included.

References to other procedures (XX-YYY Management Responsibility, QAP011) are present but the referenced documents or evidence of execution (minutes, training records, org chart) were not provided for confirmation.
recommendations: Provide management review records (minutes, action items) that explicitly show top-management endorsement of the risk management process and any resourcing decisions (e.g., staffing approvals, budget allocation). Cite the management review date(s) and link to the risk management plan or file.

Include an organizational chart or a document that shows assignment of responsibility and authority for risk management roles (named or position titles) and confirm these are recorded in the Risk Management Plan / Risk Management File.

Provide resource plans or approved staffing/budget documents that show allocation of adequate resources for risk management activities (e.g., dedicated FTEs, external consultants, tools, and training budgets).

Attach training documentation from QAP011 for personnel performing risk management: training plans, attendance/completion records, competence assessments, and qualification records demonstrating personnel competence.

If management review process (XX-YYY) and QAP011 contain the necessary evidence, cross-reference and include those documents in the Risk Management File; otherwise, update the SOP or Risk Management Plan to explicitly state where these artifacts will be stored and provide sample completed artifacts for audit traceability.

Document traceability in the Risk Management File linking the Risk Management Plan, Risk Management Report approvals, management review outputs, and evidence of assigned competent personnel so an auditor can readily verify Clause 4.2 compliance.

requirements_results.rationale: The SOP (QAP013.01) establishes a clear policy framework requiring that criteria for risk acceptability be defined and documented in the Risk Management Plan (RMP), and it references applicable regulations and standards (ISO 14971:2019, ISO/TR 24971:2020, ISO 13485:2016, 21 CFR). Key elements required by ISO 14971 Clause 4.2 are present in principle: responsibility for defining criteria is assigned to Top Management/QA, the basis for criteria (standard of care, benefit, state of the art) is stated, and the RMP/Risk Management File is required to contain the criteria and be controlled. However the artefact-level acceptance criteria require an approved, explicit Risk Acceptability Policy (or documented thresholds) and device-family principles; the SOP explicitly states it does not define thresholds and defers threshold definition to the RMP. There is no explicit evidence in the excerpt of an approved standalone Risk Acceptability Policy document, recorded acceptance thresholds, or documented device-family-specific principles. Therefore requirements are partially satisfied (policy exists as procedural requirement) but critical evidentiary artifacts and explicit thresholds/approval are not shown in the provided material — hence FLAGGED.
evidence: Section 3 References: "ISO 14971: 2019", "ISO/TR 24971:2020", "ISO 13485:2016", "21CFR820.30" (see header References)

Responsibilities (Functional Area Management): "Defines and documents criteria for risk acceptability in the Risk Management Procedure. This provides a framework that ensures that criteria are based upon applicable national or regional regulations and relevant International Standards and considers available information such as the general acknowledged state of the art and known stakeholder concerns." (Roles / Responsibilities section)

5.2.3.2.2: "Top management of Product Development, Clinical Development, Regulatory Affairs and Quality Assurance establish acceptable thresholds for residual risk acceptance within this procedure." (Risk Management Plan section)

5.2.5: "Categories of risk and criteria for risk acceptability, in accordance with this procedure, including criteria for accepting risks when the probability of occurrence of harm cannot be estimated. The risk acceptance criteria are based on the following decisions: 5.2.5.1 The risk presented by the current standard of care; 5.2.5.2 The potential health benefits ...; 5.2.5.3 The generally acknowledged state of the art ..." (Risk Management Plan section)
5.2.6: "The evaluation method and criteria for acceptability for the overall residual risk ... shall be clearly defined and documented in the risk management plan." (Risk Management Plan section)

5.3.4 / 5.3.6: "The risk management file consists of the following deliverables, at a minimum: ... 5.3.4.2. Risk Management Plan ... The risk management file shall be maintained in the associated combination product design history file (DHF)." (Risk Management File section)

1.3 Purpose / Scope: "This SOP does not define the threshold for acceptable risk (or risk index) since this threshold will change based on the intended use and expected benefit of using the combination product." (Purpose / Scope)
gaps: No explicit, approved standalone 'Risk Acceptability Policy' document or signatory approval is shown in the provided excerpt (no approval/signature block or referenced policy artifact located).

SOP states it does not define numeric or threshold values for risk acceptability (1.3). There are no example/mandatory thresholds recorded in the SOP itself; deferral to the RMP alone leaves uncertainty unless the RMP artifact is available and approved.
No evidence of documented, device-family-specific principles or pre-defined acceptability criteria for specific device families (only states RMP may be for a family, 5.2.10).
No explicit record within the excerpt showing that Top Management has formally 'established acceptable thresholds' (5.2.3.2.2) — i.e., date/versioned approval of thresholds is not shown.
No explicit evidence that stakeholder concerns have been captured and documented as inputs to the policy beyond a single mention in the Roles section.

No direct citation within the RMP (or example RMP) referencing the policy or embedding the acceptability criteria — the SOP requires RMP to contain criteria but the actual RMP artifact is not provided.
recommendations: Produce or reference a dedicated, approved 'Risk Acceptability Policy' document (or add an approval/signature block) that explicitly defines how risk acceptability criteria are established and approved; file it in the controlled document system and cross-reference it in QAP013.01.

Ensure the Risk Management Plan(s) (RMP) for each product or product family include documented, approved acceptance criteria (including numeric thresholds or decision rules where practicable), with evidence of Top Management approval (e.g., signature/date or approval record).

For device families where different thresholds/principles are needed, include explicit device-family-specific principles or links to templates in the RMP (per 5.2.10) so teams have concrete guidance rather than only procedural deferral.
Document how stakeholder concerns are identified, recorded and used when defining acceptability criteria (e.g., a brief section in the RMP or policy listing stakeholder inputs considered).

Maintain traceability: insert cross-references in QAP013.01 to the specific RMP document IDs where acceptance criteria are defined, and ensure RMPs are easily accessible to project teams (document control location, DHF link).

Retain evidence of management reviews or meeting minutes showing Top Management’s establishment of thresholds and any benefit-risk decisions (to satisfy ISO 14971 Clause 4.2 audit evidence requirements).

If not already present, include an index entry in the Risk Management File listing the Risk Acceptability Policy and the RMP(s) with versions/dates to demonstrate availability to teams as required by the acceptance criteria.
